Description:
DMCA

Please forward all DMCA takedown requests to e-mail visible above.

DO NOT SCRAPE OUR DATA

Scraping our data is PROHIBITED. Only exception is indexing necessary to make searching possible (if user allows it).

금지 사항

이 인스턴스에서는 아래 행위를 금지하고 있습니다. / This instance prohibits following activities.
  • 다음에 해당하는 컨텐츠를 CW 없이 타임라인에 올리지 마세요. / Do not upload these contents without CW:
    • 과도하게 폭력적인 컨텐츠 / Violent contents
    • 과도한 빛의 반짝임이 포함되어 일부 사용자가 발작을 일으킬 수 있는 컨텐츠 / Contents that can cause photosensitive epilepsy
    • 정치 관련 컨텐츠 / Political contents
    • 그 외 다른 사용자가 불쾌함을 느낄 수 있는 과격한 내용의 컨텐츠 (상식적으로 심한 욕설도 여기에 해당합니다) / Contents that can otherwise make other users uncomfortable (Strong swear words also fall into this category, use common sense)
  • 다른 사용자에 대해 모욕, 괴롭힘, 사칭, 명예 훼손의 목적으로 계정을 생성하거나 컨텐츠를 포스팅하지 마세요. / Do not create account or post contents to insult, harass, impersonate, or defame others.
    • 인종이나 성별, 성 정체・지향성 등에 대한 헤이트 스피치 (미스젠더링, 데드네이밍, “전환 치료” 등을 포함함) / Hate speech including but not limited to: race, gender, sexual orientation, identity, misgendering, deadnaming, or promotion of so-called "conversion therapy"
    • 모든 종류의 포르노 / All pornographic contents
    • 아동 포르노 또는 아동을 대상으로 한 학대가 담긴 컨텐츠 / CSAM or any contents with child abuse
    • 사이버 불링 / Cyberbullying
  • 이 외에도, 다음 행위는 금지됩니다. / Also, these activities are prohibited.
    • 광고 등 다른 사용자들이 원치 않는 목적의 무작위 팔로잉・멘션 행위 (스팸) / Random follow, mention that other users don't want e.g. ads (Spam)
    • VPN, 데이터센터 IP, Tor 등을 이용한 계정 생성 / Using VPN, Datacenter IP, and/or Tor to create an account
    • 일회용 이메일을 사용한 계정 생성 / Using one-time use e-mail to create an account
    • 신규 사용자에게 기존 사용자간의 문화를 강요하거나 행동을 재단하려는 행위 / Activities to force new users customs of older users
    • 가상화폐 및 NFT에 관련된 글 / Contents related to cryptocurrency or/and NFT

삼진아웃 제도 및 예외 / Three-strike out policy and exceptions

누구나 실수를 저지를 수 있고, 규칙을 일부러 어기는 것은 아닐 것입니다. 그렇기 때문에 아래와 같은 삼진아웃 제도를 도입합니다. / Anyone can make mistakes, and you probably aren't breaking rule on purpose. So, we have three-strike out policy.
  • 사용자는 규칙을 어길 시 문제가 되는 컨텐츠, 프로필을 삭제 처리하고 경고를 받습니다. / A warning will be provided and problematic contents or profile will be removed if the user goes against the rule.
  • 경고가 3번 누적된 상태에서 규칙을 어기면 계정은 정지됩니다. / One more rule breaking after users' third warning, the user will be permanently banned.
  • 경고를 받은 시점으로부터 730일이 지나면 해당 경고 기록은 없는 것으로 처리합니다. / After 730 days from the warning date, the warning will be deleted.

예외 / Exceptions

하지만, 아래에 해당하는 경우에는 예외를 적용하고, 곧바로 계정을 정지합니다. / But, if those terms apply, exception will be made and offending account will be banned immediately.
  • 스팸 계정 / Spam account
  • username이 예외 사항에 해당하는 경우 / When username is against the rule
  • 사용자 본인이나 다른 사용자들에게 커다란 신체적・정신적 피해가 초래될 수 있다고 판단되는 경우 / Case where severe physical or mental harm will be done to the user themselves or other users
    • 자해 및 자살 위험이 있거나 이를 조장하는 내용 / Contents that promotes self-harm and/or suicide
    • 과도한 수위의 헤이트 스피치 / Excessive hate speech
    • 사이버 불링 / Cyberbullying
    • 다른 장소에서 문제를 일으키거나 일으킨 문제 유저 / Problematic users who caused / are causing issues in another places
    • 미성년・사회적 약자에 대한 공격 및 성적 접근 행위 / Attacking or sexually harassing those who are under 19 years of age and/or social minorities
  • 대한민국 내에서 불법으로 취급되는 정보를 담고 있는 경우 / Contents that are illegal in South Korea
  • YuruToot 모더레이터에게 신체적・정신적 피해가 초래될 수 있는 경우 / Contents that might cause physical or mental harm for YuruToot moderators
  • 웹 브라우저・접속 기기의 보안 취약점을 사용한 XSS나 이에 상응하는 공격 행위 / Exploit attempts to this server
  • 운영 주체인 YuruVerse에 재산상 또는 금전적 피해가 초래될 수 있는 경우 / Contents that can cause YuruVerse to lose property and/or money
    • Mastodon 시스템을 악용한 서비스 거부 공격 (DoS) 등의 공격 행위 / Using Mastodon's system to perform DoS or another similar attack
    • YuruToot의 규칙의 허점을 악용한 악성 어뷰징 행위 / Exploiting YuruToot rule's loophole
  • 이 외에도, 본인이나 다른 유저들에게 끼칠 수 있는 위험을 고려해 관리자의 재량에 따라 작성 된 방법 외 다른 강도 또는 방식의 조치가 취해질 수 있습니다. / In addition to this, other form or different severity of punishment may be made by moderators considering the harm that could be made to that particular user or all other users.

    • 예외 (사일런스) / Exception (Silence)

    아래 사항에 해당하는 경우에는 사일런스를 적용합니다. / Terms that will silence your account:
    • YuruToot 로컬, 타 인스턴스의 여러 사용자에게 여러 차례 불쾌함을 주는 행위 / Activities that cause inconvenience to YuruToot's or other instances' users

    인스턴스 서비스 종료 전 고지 의무 / Commitment to give users warning in case of shutting down

    toot.funami.tech (이하 YuruToot)의 운영 주체인 YuruVerse는 YuruToot 서비스 종료 3개월 전에 모든 사용자에게 이를 고지해야 할 의무가 있습니다. / Operator of toot.funami.tech (also known as YuruToot), YuruVerse, is committed to warn users at least 3 months prior in case of shutting down.
    고지는 YuruToot 인스턴스의 @notice 계정과 이메일을 통해서 행합니다. / The notice will be given out using YuruToot account @notice and via e-mail.
    이 고지 의무에는 예외가 적용됩니다. / There is an exception to this commitment.
    • 운영 자금 고갈 등의 사유로 인해 서버 호스팅 비용 등을 더 이상 충당할 수 없는 경우 / When server operating cost is unbearable (e.g. lack of operating money)

    자동화 / Automation

    스크립트, 크로스포스터* 등의 자동화된 수단으로 Toot을 포스팅하는 자동화된 계정 (bot)의 가동은 허용하고 있으나, 다음과 같은 행위는 금지하고 있으며 위반 시 예고 없이 계정이 정지될 수 있습니다. / We allow operating accounts using automated mean of posting contents (e.g. external program, crossposter), but we prohibit these activities. Failing to abide by those rules will cause account suspension.
    또한, 과도한 API 요청으로 인해 서비스에 지장이 있을 수 있다고 판단될 시에는 접속 차단이 이루어질 수 있으니 주의하여 주십시오. / Also, disrupting our service with excessive API request will get your IP blocked.
    • 맞팔로우(follow-back)를 제외하고, 봇은 다른 계정들을 찾아다니며 능동적으로 팔로우 하는 행위를 해선 안 됩니다. / Bot must not actively follow account. Following back is allowed.
    • 봇은 능동적으로 자신을 팔로우 하고 있지 않거나 명시적으로 호출되지 않 다른 사용자의 컨텐츠에 반응해선 안됩니다. / Unless being followed or explicitly invoked, automated accounts must not react to contents.
    • 스크립트, 크로스포스터 등 자동화된 수단으로 포스트 되는 Toot은 로컬 타임라인에 올라와선 안 됩니다. / Automated Toots MUST NOT be visible on local timeline. (공개 범위를 Public(전체 공개)으로 설정하지 마십시오) / (DO NOT SET YOUR TOOT AS PUBLIC)
    ※ 자동화 된 수단이 아니더라도, 정보 전달을 목적으로 블로그 포스트나 뉴스 기사, 동영상 링크를 주기적으로 포스트하는 경우 위 사항을 준수해 주십시오. / ※ Even if it's not automated, if you're regularly uploading blog posts, news articles, video links etc, please follow clauses above.
    ※ 이 규칙이 준수되지 않는 타 인스턴스의 봇의 경우 부득이하게 사일런스 처리하고 있습니다. / ※ Other instances' automated account that does not follow those rules are silenced.
    ※ *트위터 등의 타 SNS 프로필을 긁어다 한번에 여러 포스트를 올리는 형태의 크로스포스터만 이에 해당합니다. 사용자가 직접 내용을 입력하여 여러 계정에 포스트하는 경우 (Twidere 등이 이에 해당합니다) 위 제한 사항에 해당하지 않습니다. / ※ *Only automatic crossposters have to follow those rules. If you're manually uploading all of them (e.g. Twidere), these clauses do not apply.

    사용자의 데이터 열람 및 무단 사용 금지 / Commitment to not abuse users' data

    YuruToot의 관리자 및 모더레이터는 관리 목적 외의 사유로 타인의 데이터를 무단으로 열람하거나 사용해선 안됩니다. / Moderaters and administrators of YuruToot must not look at or use users' personal data except for moderation purposes.
    그러나, 아래에 해당하거나 정당한 사유가 있는 경우 부득이하게 데이터를 열람할 수 있으며 열람 시 해당 사용자 또는 전체에게 조회 사실 및 목적에 대해 공지해야 합니다. / But, if there's vaild reason or one of those clauses apply, we have the right to look at and/or use data. In this case, notice will be made to that particular user or all users with the notice including reason.
    • 경찰 등 국가 수사 기관에 대한 협조를 위한 DB 조회 / Opening up database to comply with local law enforcement offices' requests
    • Mastodon 소프트웨어 업데이트 중 발생하는 문제 해결 / Fixing problems caused by Mastodon's new version update
    • DB / 스토리지 손상으로 인한 복구 작업 / Repairing database, storage damage

    Misc. / 기타

    Special thanks to @ihor@lviv.social for making us logo and banner! / @ihor@lviv.social에게 로고와 배너를 만들어 주신 것에 대한 감사를 드립니다!
    We use Todon, Oliphant, and chaos.social's domain block list. / 저희 서버는 Todon과 Oliphant, chaos.social의 서버 차단 리스트를 활용합니다.
    Our rules are based on Twingyeo's rules. / 저희 서버의 규칙은 트잉여의 규칙을 활용하고 있습니다.
    Donate! (GitHub Sponsors) / 후원하기! (Toss)
    Visit our other services! / 저희의 다른 서비스들도 이용 해 보세요!
Short: Safe and free-for-all hang out space without hate, discrimination, operated by YuruVerse / YuruVerse에 의해 운영되는 혐오와 차별이 없는 자유로운 대화 공간.

Description:
자커마스는 자작 캐릭터 커뮤니티, 즉 자캐커뮤를 위한 마스토돈 인스턴스입니다. 자캐커뮤에 특화된 서버 설정을 제공하며, 한국어 검색을 지원합니다.

자캐커뮤 이외 목적 가입도 가능하지만 권장하지 않습니다. 타 사용자와 교류 등 자캐커뮤 목적이 아닌 경우 타 인스턴스 가입을 권장합니다.

본 서버는 Mastodon Server Covenant를 따릅니다. 서버 폐쇄 최소 3개월 전 미리 공지드릴수 있도록 노력하겠습니다.
Short:
자커마스는 자작 캐릭터 커뮤니티, 즉 자캐커뮤를 위한 마스토돈 인스턴스입니다.
자캐커뮤에 특화된 서버 설정을 제공하며, 한국어 검색을 지원합니다.

Description:
berlin.social ist eine dezentralisierte Alternative zum zentral verwalteten Twitter.

Diese Mastodon-Instanz wird ausschließlich auf Servern innerhalb der EU von der Berliner cepharum GmbH auf Grundlage ihrer Allgemeinen Geschäftsbedingungen für Hosting-Dienstleistungen bereitgestellt. Es gelten für die Benutzung die spezifischen Datenschutzbestimmungen für diesen Service sowie die Datenschutzbestimmungen der cepharum GmbH. Als Nutzer dieses Angebots werden Sie Kunden der cepharum GmbH im Sinne der vorstehenden Nutzungsbedingungen und Bestimmungen.

Das Angebot kann kostenfrei genutzt werden. Es steht der cepharum GmbH frei, das Angebot jederzeit und in beliebiger Weise anzupassen oder vollständig einzustellen. Es besteht kein Anspruch auf Fortführung des Dienstes ohne gesonderte schriftliche Vereinbarung mit der cepharum GmbH. Diese Freiheiten werden durch folgende Einschränkungen begrenzt:

  1. Das Angebot bleibt für Nutzer kostenfrei.
  2. Eine Aufgabe des Angebots wird mindestens 3 Monate vorab angekündigt, so dass Nutzer die Möglichkeit erhalten, ihr Konto auf einen anderen Server zu übertragen.

Die cepharum GmbH erfasst keinerlei Nutzungsdaten dieser Instanz zur Finanzierung dieses Angebots. Alle Kosten werden intern als Werbekosten verbucht und aus Mitteln der cepharum GmbH quersubventioniert.

Als Betreiber des Angebots behält sich die cepharum GmbH vor, Inhalte und Nutzerkonten zu moderieren, zu sperren oder zu löschen, sofern diese gegen deutsches Recht oder oben genannte Bedingungen verstoßen. Dies umfasst unter anderem die Veröffentlichung von Beiträgen oder Nutzerprofilen mit folgenden Inhalten:

  • diskriminierende, beleidigende oder sonstwie herabwürdigende Äußerungen
  • Anfeindungen gegen Andersdenkende oder gegen Religionen oder deren Anhänger
  • Aufruf zu oder die Darstellung von Straftaten
  • pornografische Inhalte oder die Vermittlung sexueller Kontakte
  • Massenbeiträge zu kommerziellen oder politischen Werbezwecken
  • Bewerbungen für regional beschränkte Angebote bezogen auf Regionen jenseits des Großraums Berlin/Brandenburg
  • Bewerbung und Verlinkung auf externe Angebote einzig zum Zweck der Suchmaschinenoptimierungen (SEO) jener Angebote
  • die Bewerbung und/oder die Verlinkung von externen Angeboten, welche Aktivitäten und Inhalte anbieten, die gegen diese Regeln verstoßen

Wir schätzen die Meinungsfreiheit. Doch diese Instanz ist kein öffentlicher Raum. Es steht jedem frei, selbst Serversysteme zu betreiben, um Beiträge nach eigenen Regeln zum Mastodon-Fediverse beizutragen.

berlin.social is a decentralized alternative to the centrally managed Twitter.

This service is hosted on servers solely located in the EU and it is provided by Berlin-based cepharum GmbH based on its General Terms and Conditions for Hosting Services. The specific data protection terms for this service as well as the data protection terms of cepharum GmbH apply. As a user of this offer, you become a customer of cepharum GmbH within the meaning of the aforementioned terms and conditions.

The offer can be used free of charge. cepharum GmbH is free to adjust the offer at any time and in any way or to discontinue it completely. There is no right to continue the service without a separate written agreement with cepharum GmbH. These freedoms are limited by the following restrictions:

  1. The offer remains free of charge for users.
  2. An abandonment of the offer will be announced at least 3 months in advance, so that users have the possibility to transfer their account to another server.

cepharum GmbH does not collect any usage data of this instance to finance this offer. All costs are booked internally as advertising costs and cross-subsidized from cepharum GmbH funds.

As the operator of the offer, cepharum GmbH reserves the right to moderate, block or delete content and user accounts if they violate German law or the terms and conditions mentioned above. This includes, but is not limited to, the publication of posts or user profile pages with the following content:

  • discriminatory, insulting or otherwise derogatory statements
  • hostility against dissidents or against religions or their followers
  • call for or reproduction of criminal offences
  • pornographic content or the mediation of sexual contacts
  • mass contributions for commercial or political advertising purposes
  • promotions for regionally restricted offers related to regions beyond the greater Berlin/Brandenburg area
  • promotion of and linking to external content for the sole purpose of search engine optimization (SEO)
  • advertising and/or linking to external offers that provide activities and content that violate these rules.

We respect the freedom of speech. But this instance is not a public space. Everyone is free to operate servers themselves in order to contribute to the Mastodon-Fediverse based on their own rules.
Short: Alles rund um, über, aus & für Berlin

Description:
Community for gaming, technology, computer science, coding, open source software, and sometimes pictures of horrible network closets. Feel free to drop by our Discord to chit chat with us or see what game folks are playing today.

Funding is provided directly by the moderators' wallets... (ie: we don't have any and that's perfectly fine).

NO ADVERTISING WITHOUT PERMISSION! For clarification, if you sign up a new account and immediately post an advert/link to your product, brand, sex toy, casino site, etc, WE WILL BAN YOUR ASS WITHOUT HESITATION!
Short: Veracious Network hosted in central Ohio, US is comprised of folks interested in gaming, technology, science, and open source. 18+ content allowed (only with content warning included)

Description:
sciences.social is an online community for social scientists. Users here can connect with one another and the millions of other Mastodon users who have opted for social media that is ad-free and actively moderated to keep bad actors at bay. Here's how to get started.

1. Create an account

Create an account to get started. You'll be asked to agree to some ground rules. You can post about almost anything on sciences.social, but we don't allow sexism, racism, homophobia, transphobia, casteism or abusive behavior.

Once you confirm your email you'll be online. Come on back to this page (sciences.social/about) for next steps.

2. Get an app

Ice Cubes for iOS and Tusky for Android are very good and free. Mona and ivory are excellent apps for iOS/Mac users with a few dollars to spare.

Mastodon also works well from a web browser on laptops and desktops. A browser extension like Graze (chrome, mozilla) or FediAct (chrome, mozilla) will make following folks from other Mastodon servers seamless. Highly recommended.

3. Follow lots of folks

Thousands of social scientists are active on Mastodon, and you can follow anyone regardless of which server they call home. There's no algorithm to fill your feed with content so it helps to follow liberally. Our companion site find.sciences.social makes it easy to find and follow academics from many different disciplines including Sociology, Communication and Media Studies, and Political Science. Followgraph finds folks who are popular among the people you already follow.

You can also follow hashtags like #ASA2023 to see what people are posting about the conference. Or follow #rstats for hints on R and #AcademicChatter for - you know. Or maybe just #NaturePhotography for some pleasant views.

4. Start Posting and Boosting

Introduce yourself with your first post, and include an #introduction hashtag. Post about whatever you want, and use hashtags to make finding your posts easier. If you see a post you like, boost it. There's no algorithm to amplify selected voices here so we rely on boosting to see what's interesting.

More about us

sciences.social welcomes all social scientists, including professors, grad students and anyone with a graduate degree in the social sciences (sociology, anthropology, political science, communications, economics...), including people who are doing qualitative and quantitative work inside or outside academia. We want this to be a comfortable place for social scientists from all backgrounds, including those who are from marginalized or racialized groups, sexual minorities, people with disabilities and others who may not feel welcomed in some academic spaces.

sciences.social is collectively funded. It was started by Mark Igra (@markigra), a PhD student who earned enough money to start the site in a previous career. While Mark will continue to ensure sciences.social is funded, donations have helped pay for the rapid growth of the site. We encourage you to donate through our Open Collective fundraising page, which shows all of our spending. Donations through that page are tax deductible for U.S. taxpayers thanks to fiscal hosting from the Open Collective Foundation.

Mark runs this site with the help of a crew of moderators (Pratik, Kristian, Simon and Javier), with valuable advice from folks like Emily and Pamela. Let us know if you would like to help out.

Policies

At the moment, the official rules are deliberately minimal, but they have important implications. First, if you don't understand that "treat people with respect" means no sexism, racism, homophobia, transphobia or casteism and precludes abusive behavior and doxxing, then you don't belong on this site. Second, you must use your real name in your profile and we strongly encourage using your full name as your display name. While there are plenty of good reasons for anonymity on the internet, for our purposes being able to link online reputation to real-world reputation is important.

Post Visibility

Public posts appear on the local timelines and federated timelines of sciences.social and all other mastodon instances that host your followers. Consider using Unlisted for posts you want your followers to see, but would prefer not to appear in public timelines. Using Unlisted for replies is strongly encouraged.

Posts expressing racism, homophobia and the like are not allowed with or without a content warning or with any level of visibility.

Sensitive Media

You must mark media as sensitive if it contains violence or sexual content. We also request that you mark media as sensitive if it might trigger common phobias including arachnophobia (fear of spiders) and Ophidiophobia (fear of snakes).

Getting along

Folks come here from different academic, ethnic and national cultures, so there are likely to be some mismatches in tone when we talk to one another. People might be more blunt than you are used to, or you might think someone is frustratingly obtuse when they are just trying to be polite. It's best to presume that folks here are acting in good faith. Mastodon has good tools for filtering or blocking posts you don't want to see. However, if you think someone is deliberately violating the rules or negatively affecting the community as a whole, you can report them as described below.

Reporting bad behavior

One of the great strengths of Mastodon is the ability to restrict access to bad actors. sciences.social already blocks posts from dozens of sites known to host trolls and nazis, but there'll be other bad behavior. If you use the "Report" action on someone's post the moderators can review it and take action to restrict that account. Reporting helps even for people who make their home on other servers.

Content Warnings

Content warnings are an important part of both the technical infrastructure and the culture of the Mastodon online community. They aren't just used for "triggering" content but also are often treated as a “headline” that allows people to choose whether they want to read the whole post. Click the CW link on your post to set one.

We strongly encourage the use of content warnings for posts that you think might be triggering or of limited interest, for example mentions of death or violence, and political debates centered on one country or locality.

While expressions of racism, casteism, homophobia, and transphobia are off-limits, we do not require content warnings for posts about those topics and their effects on people, whether academic or otherwise. Use your own judgment about using content warnings on these topics.

Site Visualization

The current header image is a public domain visualization from W.E.B. Du Bois exhibit at the 1900 Paris Exhibition. Expect changing visualizations over time
Short: Non-profit, ad-free social media for social scientists. Join thousands of social scientists here and across the fediverse.

Description:
Sciences.Re souhaite offrir un espace de partage, de collaboration et de discussion en ligne pour la communauté scientifique, académique, éducative francophone.

Cette instance est destinée aux communautés liées à l'enseignement et à la recherche francophone, sans coloration thématique. Si vous travailler dans une université, un labo de recherche, un lycée, une prépa, une grande école, cette instance vous ouvre ses portes ! Si ce n'est pas le cas, une liste d'autres serveurs pouvant probablement vous accueillir est disponible à cette adresse.

Cependant, aucune limite n'est imposée concernant le contenu des discussions ayant lieu sur cette instance ; il n'y a pas de « off-topic » ou de « on-topic », c'est aux personnes qui utilisent l'instance d'en faire ce qu'elles veulent (dans la limite des règles de l'instance, bien évidemment). Il serait en effet difficile (et probablement contre-productif) de lister les sujets de discussion autorisés ou interdits.

Cette instance ne restreint pas son indexation par des moteurs de recherche.

Règles concernant la fédération

Le mode de fonctionnement de Sciences.Re est une fédération ouverte par défaut, avec une liste d'exclusion à deux niveaux :

  1. Les serveurs « limités » voient l'ensemble de leurs comptes limités : un compte limité est caché à tous les autres utilisateurs de l'instance, à l'exception de ceux qui le suivent. Tout le contenu est toujours présent et peut être trouvé par le biais de la recherche, des mentions et du suivi, mais le contenu est invisible publiquement.

  2. Les serveurs « suspendus » voient l'ensemble de leurs comptes suspendus : un compte suspendu n'apparaît plus dans les recherches, sa page de profil a disparu, tous ses messages, ses téléchargements, ses followers et toutes les autres données sont supprimées. Cependant, cette suspension n'est effective que dans un sens : le serveur suspendu peut encore accéder au contenu non privé de ce serveur.

Un serveur pourra être limité, par exemple, si il ne respecte pas les règles sur l’étiquetage de la pornographie et de la nudité comme « NSFW », ou l’étiquetage des contenus sensibles/choquants avec un « Content Warning » approprié.

Un serveur pourra être suspendu, par exemple, si ses membres, de manière systémique, harcèlent d’autres utilisateurs ou utilisatrices, incluant, sans s’y limiter, les menaces de toute sorte, les insultes, les blagues et le langage discriminatoires, les attentions sexuelles importunes, la publication d’informations d’identification personnelle (“doxing”), ou perturbent délibérément des discussions ou des membres via du trolling, du spam, du flaming, du baiting, de la recherche d’attention, de la distribution de malware, ou tout type d’attaque contre l’infrastructure informatique du projet Sciences.Re ou de ses organisations collaboratrices.

Avant de procéder à une suspension de serveur, un délai raisonnable est laissé au serveur pour lui permettre de modérer le contenu de son côté, après une demande de modération effectuée par l'équipe de modération de Sciences.Re. En absence de réaction au terme de ce délai raisonnable, le serveur sera suspendu.

Il est possible de proposer des serveurs à suspendre ou à limiter aux modérateurs de l'instance, joignables via le compte @contact@sciences.re ; toute demande argumentée sera considérée.

Soutenir le serveur financièrement

Envie de participer aux coûts financiers que ce serveur représente ? Cliquez sur l'image ci-dessous :
Short: Sciences·Re souhaite offrir un espace de partage, de collaboration et de discussion en ligne pour la communauté scientifique, académique, éducative francophone. Elle est sans coloration thématique.

Description:
Herzlich Willkommen in der Medibubble!

Selbstverständlich ist auf diesem Server jede* und jeder* willkommen, ungeachtet des medizinischen Hintergrundes. Wir gehen hier anständig und fürsorglich miteinander um, haben von medizinischer Aufklärung bis hin zu Flachwitzen alles zu bieten und machen es uns hier einfach gemütlich und schön.
Also dann: Willkommen in unserem Wohnzimmer, Kaffee und kalte Getränke stehen da drüben, wenn es Fragen gibt, fragt einfach und wer sich nackig macht, wird sonographiert!

Dies soll ein sicherer Hafen für alle sein.
Seid großartig und respektvoll miteinander.



Wer gegen eine oder mehrere der folgenden Regeln verstößt, kann sanktioniert werden:

Description:
About toot.community

Welcome to toot.community - your gateway to the wider Fediverse! We're a generic Mastodon instance proudly hosted in The Netherlands, committed to providing an open, ad-free, and respectful environment for all our users.

Our instance serves as a platform for dialogue, connection, and shared learning, embodying the values of inclusivity and respect. We strive to maintain a welcoming atmosphere for people from all walks of life, irrespective of their race, ethnicity, gender, religion, or nationality.

By joining toot.community, you're stepping into a world where voices from across the globe intermingle. It's more than just a Mastodon instance—it's a portal to the greater Fediverse, a universe teeming with diverse thoughts, cultures, and ideas.

Supporting toot.community

Here at toot.community, we value your privacy and peace of mind over everything else. That's why we promise not to display advertisements or sell your data. Instead, we operate on the goodwill and generous contributions of our members.

Maintaining and operating a server comes with its share of expenses. Currently, these costs are entirely borne by user donations and @jorijn. If you enjoy our services and have an account with us, we kindly ask you to consider supporting us financially.

Every bit helps us maintain our independence and ensures that we can continue to provide a secure, ad-free platform for everyone hosted on this instance. It provides a measure of financial security and helps us keep this wonderful community thriving.

There are two ways you can donate:

  1. Support via Ko-Fi - Accepts payments through Credit Card, PayPal, Apple Pay, and Google Pay. As a token of our gratitude, everyone who donates through Ko-Fi receives a special shoutout on our @funding account.
  2. Support via Patreon - Accepts payments through Credit Card. Regular contributions via Patreon help us plan for the future with confidence.

Code of Conduct

We intend to protect all members of our community from harassment and to ensure that our community is as welcoming and inclusive as possible. This document contains the rules and principles for participating in our platform. This is a working document, so our team may amend it from time to time.

Goals

  • Provide a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, political affiliation, or other similar characteristics.
  • Create a supportive community where people freely share their passions and are excited and optimistic about each other's successes.
  • Protect our community from harassment, malicious or illegal content, and individual members whose goals are to disrupt our community and promote their own self-interest at the expense of the community.

Principles that Guide us

  • We are not a free speech zone. This CoC lays out expected standards of conduct and behavior. You cannot say or post anything violating these rules or principles and remain a community member. You must follow this CoC. If you are looking for something else, please do. It is not here.
  • The Moderators are not morality or thought police. Moderators are guided by this Code of Conduct. Post what you want if what you post follows these rules, principles, and the goals outlined above. Not every community member will appreciate controversial or explicit posts, so use Content Warnings liberally. We use Content Warnings so community members themselves can decide whether they want to see or engage with a post that may be controversial or explicit.
  • Bullies, trolls, and disruptors are not welcome in our community. We will moderate accordingly.
  • This is a voluntary community. You chose to be here. When you decide to join, you have implied that you agree with this Code of Conduct and will follow it.

Rules for posting

The rules you need to follow if you want to be a member of our community are stated below.

General guidance on posting and participating in this community

  • Do not post about inflammatory, controversial subjects without a Content Warning. Ideally, you would not post about provocative topics at all. However, it may be acceptable to do so in some cases. Still, posting inflammatory content without hiding the content behind an appropriate Content Warning is never good.
  • Do not post any nudity without a Content Warning.
  • Regarding Spam: We are not your free advertising platform. You will be removed if you are here only to sell your products or services. Occasional posts of commercial links are OK, but when most of a user's posts are commercial, we regard the account as Spam account. Moderators will evaluate reports of Spam on a case-by-case basis.
  • Do not engage in name-calling, ad hominem attacks, or other uncivil behavior. Criticize ideas, never people.
  • Do not report every post that upsets you. Please report posts that violate our rules but for others that you may find distasteful or don't like, use the tools available to you. You can block the user or mute the conversation.

Moderation Principles

Reported content will be assessed on a balance of probabilities by the moderators. In other words, whether it's more likely than not that the content violates one or more of these rules. Moderators will suspend an account from this community when the user demonstrates that they have breached any rule several times or if their content (including profile description) suggests that they are likely to continue to break the rules. The number of breaches leading to suspension is deliberately not defined. In egregious cases, one violation can result in suspending the user account.

The moderation team takes a pragmatic approach to every report they receive - if they feel that a problematic post isn't explicitly a breach of any of these rules but is inappropriate for this community, the post will likely be removed. Users who repeatedly post problematic content or are seen by the moderators as a negative, disruptive presence in our community can be removed at the moderation team's discretion, even if those posts or the user did not explicitly violate our rules.

Server Statistics / Information

  • FediDB
  • Fediverse.Observer
  • Uptime status report
  • Blog

Contact

Your questions, feedback, and concerns are always welcome. For any instance-related queries or support needs, please reach out to our dedicated @support account.

Alternatively, you can write to us via:

Email: support@toot.community

For any other correspondence, please use our postal address:

toot.community
Postbus 465
4900 AL Oosterhout NB
The Netherlands

Thank you for being part of our community! We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you.
Short: A worldwide Mastodon instance from The Netherlands. Run by digital enthusiasts, inviting everyone, everywhere to join us in the #fediverse.

Description:
Funding



This server is currently funded through support from ATLAS Media Group as well as the very generous contributions from our Ko-Fi supporters! We are hosted fully on Superior Networks London Region.

We are also welcoming contributions towards the running costs of the server as we grow, you can do so on our Ko-Fi

You can alternatively support is through our Patreon page.

Reporting and moderation



When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to punitive action and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first-time offences, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offences.

Service Status:

You can find our real time service status on the ATLAS Media Group Status Page.
Short: UK Hosted and Managed Mastodon Instance. General communal space for discussion, everyone welcome!

Description:
Important!

Sign-ups currently require admin approval, unless you have an invite link from an existing user.

Feel free to put anything as the join reason, or just link to an existing social media account. (Funny messages encouraged, but not required!)

Most approvals will take a few hours, but if your account is still pending, feel free to reach out to @Crashdoom on Telegram.

"PAWBS ARE FUN THOUGH!"

-Crashdoom

This instance aimed at any and all within the furry fandom, though anyone is welcome! We're friendly towards members of the LGBTQ+ community and aiming to offer a safe space for our users.

We do not federate with fascist instances and do not tolerate fascist users.

pawb.fun is part of the pawb.social network!

Staff Team

  • @Crashdoom - Owner / Head Admin
  • @Natebluehooves - Administrator (SysAdmin)
  • @Doridian - Administrator
  • @itsOasus - Administrator
  • @herzenschein - Moderator

Moderation / Content Policies

Network Policy

We are part of pawb.social network. Any user or instance found to violate our content policies will be suspended from all instances within the pawb.social network.

Federation Policy

We are an open-first instance, however in cases where an instance had been identified as being, indifferent to, permissive of, or actively encouraging abusive conduct, that instance will be blocked from federation.

User Conduct Policy

In the hopefully unlikely event that a user breaks the rules, the offending content will be removed and the user suspended. For harassment, discrimination, or illegal activity, the user's account will be terminated.

User Generated Content

We ask that all profile content (avatar, header, display name, bio, etc.) are completely safe, without any explicit or suggestive content.

Illegal content, or content depicting hate symbolism or iconography, will be removed and result in termination of the offending user.

Report System

Please report posts that make you feel uncomfortable, break the rules, or you otherwise think should be brought to our attention. You will never be penalized for using the report system in good faith.

Donate

While donations are not expected or required, if you want to help towards our hosting, hardware, and upgrades, you can over at Ko-fi!
Short: This instance aimed at any and all within the furry fandom, though anyone is welcome! We're friendly towards members of the LGBTQ+ community and aiming to offer a safe space for our users.
topic: Pawb.Fun - Pawbs, beans, and all things fluffy

Description:
Welcome to Universeodon.com

Where the universe meets Mastodon :)

About

Universeodon.com is a space for all humans who have a little curiosity. The kind of person who enjoys edutainment, reads books, watches science shows and loves to connect with people who view the universe through wonder. There are no forced topics here, but I hope you will find scientists, engineers, philosophers, physicists, and connect with people who share similar interests & passions.

From exploring the universe, to exploring the world we all share - everyone is welcome here.

Whether you love music, movies, TV, sports, books or knitting or anything in between - We all live in this wonderful universe, and I hope to see you exploring your hobbies, passions, and interests with amazing people across the #FEDIVERSE - The Universe ;)

Funding & Community Support

This server is currently funded through support from ATLAS Media Group as well as the very generous contributions from our Ko-Fi supporters! We are hosted fully on Superior Networks London Region.

We are also welcoming contributions towards the running costs of the server as we grow, you can do so on our Ko-Fi

You can alternatively support is through our Patreon page.

Federated Community

This service is community driven and runs on the Mastodon open-source platform. We're fully federated and connected to the over 10 million other people on the #fediverse.

Security

  • Backed up locally and offsite
  • https everywhere


Please note: It is important that you protect your account with 2factor authentication. You can set this up after you register.
Direct Messages (DMs) - These are just direct "toots" - They are not encrypted. Please only use DMs to send anything you just don't want broadcasted but is not confidential. (The developers are exploring end to end encryption here)

Welcome to the #fediverse
Short: Be one with the #fediverse. Join millions of humans building, creating, and collaborating on Mastodon Social Network.

Description:
Urbanists.Social is a Mastodon instance for urbanists - people who are into bikes, transit, and / or walkable cities.

Want to donate to us? Check out our Open Collective here!

We generally align ourself with the policies and goals of other instances like mastodon.social, awoo.space, and icosahedron.website. We want our server to be a safe space for our users. Generally the rules boil down to "don't be a dick", but a few worth drawing attention to:

  • Any content that is illegal under US or EU law is prohibited. We're run by a small community, please don't get us in trouble.
  • No racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, and any other discriminatory conduct that attacks any individual or group of individuals based on what they are or what they believe is strictly forbidden. This excludes shitting on drivers, but still try to be nice.
  • Any conduct that abuses this Mastodon instance, or any other Mastodon instance, is strictly forbidden.
  • Your user profile (including your name and display name) must be SWF. NSFW content is not banned, but please be sure to tag it appropriately.
  • Please be considerate and respectful of others. Consider adding content warnings to your posts about controversial subjects or commonly-held phobias.
  • No harassment. Harassment is any improper or unwelcome conduct that might reasonably be expected or be perceived to cause offence or humiliation to another person.

Our admins on this server are @sam and @zak.

This is not Twitter. Reporting posts that make you feel uncomfortable, or that you feel should be brought to our attention, is highly encouraged. Your reports will not be ignored, and will be dealt with (usually) within a few days. It may take more than a week due to timezone differences or jobs, but you will always hear back about your report, and it won't be closed until you're happy with the resolution for the report. If your report involves a user or post on another instance, you have the choice of sharing your report with the administration of that instance as well, but the report will always be sent to us. Please include in the report whether you chose to send the report to the other instance, though.

No moderation actions are automatic whatsoever. Nothing happens without human review.

We follow the Mastodon server covenant. If we decide to close the server, we will give you minimum three months notice. Our hosting provider, masto.host, does daily backups of our database.

Defederation policy

Defederation occurs when we limit access to other Mastodon instances. We do this through domain blocks, where we silence or suspend other servers by their domain name. Silencing an instance will make all posts from all accounts on the instance invisible to anyone who isn't following them on our server. Suspending will remove all of the instance’s content and media, and will not allow you to follow any users there.

We use domain blocks to keep our server safe, to pressure other instances to moderate more effectively, and to decrease the amount of moderation of remote content we have to do. We monitor the [#Fediblock](https://urbanists.social/tags/FediBlock) for reports from users and admins for troublesome accounts and instances.

We don’t yet have a specific set of rules we follow when blocking instances, but generally this is our policy:

  • Any instance whose purpose, stated goals, or moderation rules conflict with any of our rules are immediately suspended. Fairly self-explanatory. We don’t want this content on our server.
    • Example: We do not allow promotion of crypto. Cryptodon clearly breaks this rule and it has been suspended.
    • Another example: There are multiple instances for TERFs. We do not allow TERFs or ‘gender critical’ bullshit on our server, so multiple TERF sites have been suspended.
  • Instances that do not have adequate prohibition of hate speech or harassment are immediately suspended.
    • A large percentage of these instances are ‘free speech’ servers with little to no rules. Remaining federated with these instances opens our users to a high possibility of receiving abuse from them.
    • Example: Gab does not have adequate rules against hate speech. It’s an alt-right hellhole known for harassing lots of minorities in the Fediverse. So it has been suspended.
  • Instances with admins that engage in hate speech or harassment are immediately suspended.
    • Admins that do this are not capable of moderating hate speech or harassment, point blank. We do not want our users to be subject to their users’ harassment or hate speech.
    • Example: Alex Gleason is a well-known TERF who regularly posts hate speech and harassment on his servers. This behavior attracts more TERFs to his servers who engage in the same behavior. As a result, all instances Gleason runs are suspended on our server.
  • Instances that are on lots of our peers’ block lists are very likely to be suspended.
    • We trust the admin work of our peer instances, especially those that are larger than our own server. As a server that hasn’t received a lot of abuse, we like to prevent it before it happens. Watching other instances’ block lists is key to making this happen.
  • Instances reported on #FediBlock are very likely to be silenced or suspended.
    • If we get repeat reports about an instance on the [#FediBlock](https://urbanists.social/tags/FediBlock) hashtag, we are very likely to take action against that instance. A high frequency of these reports from multiple users usually indicates a good candidate for a domain block.
    • Example: The admin of journa.host has been the subject of numerous complaints on the FediBlock tag. As a result of this, they have been silenced. This prevents our users from receiving random harassment from their users, while also allowing our users to follow users on the server.
  • Instances with questionable moderation are highly likely to be silenced or suspended.
    • Example: c.im bans exactly one server. They’ve received numerous complaints on #FediBlock due to their admin not moderating content effectively. As a result of this, we’ve silenced their server.

Instances on Probation

Users have requested the following instances to be unblocked, and the admins have reviewed them and put them on a probation list. We'll take any reports against these instances seriously and we'll be more likely to block them again.

  • qoto.org (23 Nov 2022)
Short: We're a server for people who like bikes, transit, and walkable cities. Let's get to know each other!

Description:
Note: this info below is subjected to change as time continues. Those (significant) changes will be communicated in the announcements and by @hello@mastodon.vlaanderen.

Last update: Wednesday 21 February 2024

Change of ownership and server migrations

In January 2024, the admins and sponsors of this instance declared their intention to stop this instance. In order to keep it alive nonetheless, the team behind Mastodon Belgium offered to migrate this instance to their infrastructure to keep it alive. This migration is now nearly complete.

Welcome!

The team behind this Mastodon Instance is committed to bring you the best possible experience of the decentralized Twitter alternative called Mastodon. This instance is provided mainly for those who live in the Benelux area. But others who live in other countries are welcome too! As long as they keep their public posts in Dutch, French, German, or English to make moderation easier among other things. We - the admins of mastodon.vlaanderen - want to aim for a 'localized' experience for our (Benelux) users as much as possible.

If you want more information regarding this instance, feel free to drop an e-mail to hello[at]mastodon.vlaanderen.

For those who are new to Mastodon and the Fediverse in general. I can recommend those resources to you:

  • A guide to Mastodon by Jeroen Baert
  • fedi.tips

This mastodon instance is run by individuals just like you. Those are

  • Johan Silkens (Administrator/Moderator)

  • Jessica (Administrator/Moderator)

  • Gert Jan (Administrator/Moderator)

  • Bart (Administrator/Moderator)

(Financial) contributions

It's possible to contribute (financially) to this instance. This can be done by a (recurring) donation and/or becoming a moderator.

Becoming a moderator

You can discuss this with the admin @admin@mastodon.vlaanderen or by sending an e-mail to hello[at]mastodon.vlaanderen

Donations

This server runs entirely on donations. We do not serve targeted ads and we do not sell your data as you can read in our Privacy Policy.

There are several ways you can do a (recurring) donation.

  • Via PayPal
  • Via a bank transfer: BE11 7351 3917 1948 with "Mastodon Vlaanderen" as the description
  • Via OpenCollective. A similar platform to Patreon but with the choice that you can freely choose the amount you want to donate. Recurring or not.

Recurring donations are preferred over one-time donations, because hosting this platform is also a recurring cost.

Code of Conduct

We expect all users that are using our instance to adhere to our rules and Code of Conduct and agree to our Terms Of Service listed below. Those guidelines are not a legal document, but they are here to provide you with an insight into our content and moderation policies. The final interpretation/decision is up to the administrators of mastodon.vlaanderen.

Guidelines for other Fediverse instances

All users that interact with our instance from another instance must also follow an "common sense" practice and the admin(s) and moderators must have a good and active moderation policy. We will limit or block an entire instance if they do not have such policies in place, hosting illegal and/or abusive material, ... etc. You can find which instances we block/limit on our about page.

If you are an instance admin and believe we unjustly block/limit your instance. Send an e-mail to hello[at]mastodon.vlaanderen.

Terms of Service

Usage by (commercial) entities

Entities commercial or not are allowed on this instance. Although we recommend setting up your own instance for a variety of reasons. Setting up a Mastodon instance is not that hard nowadays since the existence of services that serves you managed Mastodon instances and do the maintenance for you. They have also better uptime guarantees and SLA (Service Level Agreement) than the average Mastodon instance that are mostly run by individuals just like this one. Which is important if your brand (heavily) relies on social media.

If you want more information about this matter. Consult the @admin or send an e-mail. We can help you out finding a good instance for you.

If you still want to join this instance, there are some guidelines/rules you must follow. To make validation easier.

  • You must have an Belgian VAT number on your website and/or being based in Belgium
  • Signup with your brand's e-mail domain like social@yourbrand.be and not with a public e-mail service like Gmail.

Usage by famous/well-known/public people

Well-known people are allowed to use this instance. But keep in mind that we can ask you to verify yourself if we suspect that the signed up account was made by an impersonator without a clear view that it is a parody account.

We can ask you to provide one of these for the verification process:

  • a government issued ID

  • a driver's license.

The verification process is done by e-mail. You will receive one form hello[at]mastodon.vlaanderen and a DM from one of the admin's that you should have received an e-mail from us. The e-mails will be permanently deleted for safety reasons when the verification process is complete.

Just like for (commercial) entities, we recommend you to host your own instance so that people can instantly verify that you are really the one that you claim to be. Which is not always guaranteed on a random instance.

Usage by bots

Bots are allowed on this instance under circumstances:

  • Excessive posting with public visibility are forbidden. This may annoy other users who want to discover stuff in the local timeline

  • The maintainer of the bot must be displayed in the bot's bio

  • When using data from 3rd party sources. Make sure you have permission to use it.

  • Follow the rules defined by this instance as well as abide by the ToS and CoC

Termination of the service

The admins of mastodon.vlaanderen have the right to suspend any account if they believe that the suspended account was not following the rules defined by this server. Or did not abide by the terms of service. The suspended account have 30 days to download their data to be used to move to another instance if they wish. Some data may be retained so that the user cannot evade suspension. The user has the right to appeal their suspension once. Like we stated above, the admins have the right about the final fate of the suspended account without any discussion.

The account can also be (temporary) freezed and/or we can block the access to our services if we believe the user was doing stuff that degrades the performance of the service and/or was involved in illegal activities.

Quality of the service

Like we said earlier we try to give the users the best experience Mastodon (and the Fediverse in general) can have. The servers are monitored and back-upped regularly. But as with any service, some downtime can occur. When that happens we will try our best to do get it back up online within a "reasonable" time.

Since this Mastodon instance is run by individuals and not as a commercial service with SLA's and similar stuff. Don't expect from us that we fix stuff in the middle of the night or during business hours with a tight deadline. Because we all have a paid job and other obligations besides running and maintaining this instance.

You can check our status page for that. Keep it as an bookmark in your browser as we will put our updates on that platform as well.

Cross-posting from other sources (such as Twitter)

Cross-posting is copying of posts from one platform to another via automatic ways. It is allowed but under the following circumstances:

  • The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person or entity. Third-party copying is not permitted
  • The (Mastodon) account is at least partially monitored by the author, so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored.

(very) Brief server infrastructure information

  • The servers that runs the Mastodon software as well as the underlying database & media are sponsored & hosted in Belgium by Barnes & Morgan BV.
  • Our e-mails are managed and stored by a Belgian mail provider MailFence

The servers are backed-up at least on a daily basis.
Short: De Vlaamse/Belgische Mastodon instance.

Reporting and moderation

I usually handle reports within 24 hours, but this may vary depending on how busy I am. Please remember that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible.

Moderated Servers

Funding

Description:
Please read the server rules and the information below before signing up to and/or using Zirkus. If you don’t agree to all of the terms set out here, please do not use this server. By continuing to use Zirkus, you agree to be bound by the terms set out here.


Guidelines

  • Language: There are no language rules on this server. English is de facto the main language, but feel free (even encouraged!) to post in other languages.
  • Content warnings: We do not require a content warning (CW) for posts about politics, social justice, etc. However, we ask that you be kind and considerate: include CWs if you believe your post may be distressing.
  • Bots: Bots are allowed. Try to make them fun.
  • Cross-posting: Cross-posting from Twitter, RSS, etc. is fine (and even encouraged if it helps you become more active here).
  • Topics: You do not need to remain permanently "on topic". The point of this arts/humanities community is to gather like-minded people who will make posts that are interesting to each other. But that doesn't mean that everything has to be about books, art, etc. This is a community to connect people, not enforce specific topics of discussion.
  • Self-promotion: There are many writers and artists on this server, and we are more than happy for you to promote your work from your personal account. We request, however, that you do so in a tasteful and not spammy manner.
  • Industry promotion: If you are a commercial entity of interest to our community (literary magazine, publishing house, etc.), we are also happy for you to promote here in a tasteful manner. However, we request that you make a modest donation, as this is a volunteer-run server that relies on crowdfunding (see below). Please contact the admins if you have any questions.


Donations

  • You can donate to Zirkus on Patreon here.
  • We are run entirely by volunteers on a non-profit basis and are dependent on donations to cover our hosting costs.
  • We're currently hosted on masto.host and are looking to raise $420/month to support 5,500 users comfortably. We will publish new goals as necessary based on our user numbers.
  • We ultimately hope to crowdfund via Open Collective, which offers greater transparency over expenses and more flexibility for contributors. Our Patreon page is a temporary solution while we await approval from a fiscal host on Open Collective. Once we have migrated crowdfunding to Open Collective, all funds raised on Patreon will be transferred to that account, the Patreon page will be shut down and contributors will be informed of the move.
  • Every little helps a lot. We’d like to thank our community for all their support so far!


Moderation and reporting posts

  • When you report an account or server, please indicate which server rule has been broken and include any extra context or explanation, if possible.
  • We are volunteer moderators and will try to address the issue as soon as we are able.
  • You will not be notified about the result, even if it has led to punitive action, which may not be visible to the outside. The response will be proportional to the nature of the offence.


Post visibility and privacy

  • Please bear in mind that your posts – depending on their visibility – are public. We recommend not sharing information publicly that you do not intend to share with the whole internet.
  • When you post, bear in mind that posts cannot be hidden by locking an account. Posts can be deleted either manually or set to auto-delete within various timeframes. Please familiarize yourself with the different visibility options for posting: Public, Unlisted, Followers Only, and Mentioned People Only (i.e. a direct message).
  • The displaying and distribution of your post happens strictly according to the visibility rules you have set for the post. We will not modify the visibility of the post you have set.


Your data and privacy

  • We can see basic account and profile information that you provide when signing up to the server, such as username, email, name (real or fake) and IP address.
  • We do not share your information with any third parties.
  • The server administrators can technically access users’ direct messages, but pledge not to do so. This option is also not available in the default admin UI. We strongly recommend not sending any confidential or private information via direct message on Mastodon (or equally on Twitter) because the messages are not end-to-end encrypted. WhatsApp and Signal are currently end-to-end encrypted applications.
  • We do not log information about your use of this server or run any form of analytics. Our hosting provider, masto.host, keeps a log of the IP addresses of the requests made to the server, which is auto-deleted in less than 90 days.


Liability

  • You are responsible for the content that you make available to the server, including its legality and appropriateness. Please abide by the above server rules when using Zirkus. In case of breach of rules, the administrators reserve the right to remove you.
  • In no event will Zirkus, the administrators and the moderators be liable to you or any third party for any special, indirect, incidental, exemplary or consequential damages of any kind arising out of or in connection with the server and content included on or otherwise made available to you through the server.


Moderators

  • @lexipenia@zirk.us (admin)
  • @hyoyoonkang@zirk.us
Short: Literature, philosophy, film, music, culture, politics, history, architecture: join the circus of the arts and humanities! For readers, writers, academics or anyone wanting to follow the conversation.

Description:
Social networking, back in your hands!

Sharing your thoughts has never been more convenient. Publish anything you want: links, pictures, text, video. All on a platform that is community-owned and ad-free.

You have 500 characters. You can adjust the thumbnails of your pictures with focal points. You can use custom emojis, hide things behind spoiler warnings and choose who sees a given post. Messed it up? You can delete & redraft for quick corrections.

Without an incentive to sell you things, Mastodon allows you to consume content you enjoy uninterrupted. Your feed is chronological, ad-free and non-algorithmic—you decide who you want to see!

Tor access

We also offer a way to access Masto.ai via the Tor network with our own .onion URL address.

You can access Masto.ai on Tor via https://yiynyc2lymecpdexzodzr6lihlte4n3bdsi36uphe5sbkpwbwrl3unad.onion

Support the community

Since we do not serve ads and we do not sell data we rely on your support. If you like you can donate to help us out a little.

You can help out the community by donating in several ways:

  • Become a Patron
  • Support with PayPal
  • Credit Card Direct
  • Support on LiberaPay
  • Buy us a Ko-Fi

European Bank Deposit / IBAN

Stuxhost
NL53 BUNQ 2061 1682 13
BUNQ NL2A XXX

Staff

In addition to the site's owner, @stux Mastodon.ai's admin & moderation staff include:

  • @PhillyCodeHound (admin)
  • @antonioserrata (moderation)

Cross-posting

"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps, we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.

Cross-posting from Mastodon to other platforms is fully permitted. Cross-posting into Mastodon from another platform is permitted under the following terms:

  1. The posts do not include platform-specific references, e.g. talking about "here" meaning Twitter, or including text from other non-Mastodon users verbatim (e.g. cross-posted quote tweets)
  2. The account is at least semi-regularly monitored by the author, so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored
  3. The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted

Digital Security on Mastodon: Advice for those in conflict zones or other high-risk areas:

When using Mastodon in conflict zones or other high-risk areas, it is particularly important to be aware of how you can protect your account and digital information. While every situation is different, you can improve the general security of your Mastodon account and manage its visibility in a few steps. Navigating account settings is critical for human rights activists, journalists and others facing digital security threats. With the evolving situation in Ukraine.

  • You can review your post and account visibility under account settings
  • Read more on post and account visibility here

What to do about self-harm and suicide concerns on Mastodon

If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, you’re not alone. Use the contact info below to get help.

  • United States: Contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). Crisis workers are available 24 hours a day. Calls are free and confidential.
  • Other countries & regions: To find a crisis center near you, visit International Association for Suicide Prevention.

If you or someone you know is thinking about engaging in self-harm or suicidal behavior, you should seek help as soon as possible by contacting services with expertise in crisis intervention and suicide prevention.

Hosted by Stuxhost.com.

Contact

  • info@masto.ai
  • dmca@masto.ai

Moderated servers

On Masto.ai we handle the same blocking / muting list as on mstdn.social. You can find the full list here.

Description:
Welcome to Hachyderm.io

Pronounced hack-a-derm like pachyderm. (What is a pachyderm?)

Non-User Accounts Restricted

Please also see "Note for Non-User Accounts" at the bottom of this page

Many accounts for non-users are restricted and/or invite-only on this server. This includes but is not limited to: companies, businesses, business-like entities, events, publications, projects, agencies, bots, and so on. Please refer to our Account Types Documentation and reach out to the admin team ( admin@hachyderm.io ) prior to creating an account if you are creating an account for anything other than yourself for personal use.

About

Here we are trying to build a curated network of respectful professionals in the tech industry around the globe. Welcome anyone who follows the rules and needs a safe home or fresh start.

We are hackers, professionals, enthusiasts, and are passionate about life, respect, and digital freedom. We believe in peace and balance.

Safe space. Tech Industry. Economics. OSINT. News. Rust. Linux. Aurae. Kubernetes. Go. C. Infrastructure. Security. Black Lives Matter. LGTBQIA+. Pets. Hobbies.

Community Links

Learn more about our Community by looking at:

  • Community Docs
  • Blog
  • GitHub Community Issue Tracker
  • 💞🐘Current Emojis 🐘💞

Funding

Hachyderm is funded via the Hachyderm project GitHub Sponsor page as well as other donation sources. Please see our Funding and Thank You documentation page for more information about additional ways to donate.

Moderation and Community Safety

Hachyderm is actively moderated to protect our most vulnerable members. Our primary rule is Don't Be A Dick and all other rules are to capture common "whataboutisms" that we want to clearly state are included by Don't Be A Dick. Our server rules, including Don't Be A Dick, are explained on our Community Docs.

When making moderation decisions, our moderators abide by our Moderator Covenant. This is to both hold ourselves accountable as well as provide transparency, and build community trust, around how we handle issues that might appear to fall into "grey areas".

If you experience an issue that needs moderator action / intervention, please look at our documentation page for how to report issues to the moderators.

Reporting Hachyderm Issues and Outages

Technical issues with the Hachyderm site, including full / partial outages and features that are not working correctly, need to be reported to us via our GitHub Community Issue Tracker.

New to Mastodon?

If you're new to Mastodon in general, we recommend taking a look at Mastodon.Help's brief explainer about what Mastodon is and isn't, as well as taking a look at fedi.tips for some How To Dos.

Note for Non-User Accounts

Also referred to as Specialized Accounts in our Documentation

Although regular user accounts are only subject to regular server rules, specialized / entity / "novelty" / "focus" accounts have some additional restrictions. To learn more, please see our Account Types documentation page. A short summary of what to know:

  • Company, company-like, and/or business accounts, currently known as corporate accounts, are invite-only. Unofficial corporate accounts will be suspended.
    • Anyone looking to create an account of this type must reach out to the admin team at admin@hachyderm.io.
  • Those looking to create accounts for non-profit entities should reach out to the admin team at admin@hachyderm.io.
  • Bot accounts are allowed with restrictions (please see our Bot Account documentation).
  • Qualifying Open Source Project accounts are allowed (please see our OSS Project and Community Events documentation).
  • Qualifying Community Events are allowed (please see our OSS Project and Community Events documentation).
  • Essentially: anyone interested in creating an account that is not a general user should reach out to the admin team at admin@hachyderm.io.
  • Large / Influencer account set ups and transfers, which is defined as more than 10k on any platform, need to reach out to the Admin team prior to transfer at admin@hachyderm.io.

For more information about all of the above, please see our Account Types documentation.

Unrecognized specialized account types will be suspended. Commonly suspended / unrecognized subtypes are:

  • NSFW / 18+
  • Fundraising
  • Unofficial company / corporate accounts

This is not an exhaustive list. If you are unsure if the specific specialized account you have in mind is allowed, please reach out to us at admin@hachyderm.io.

Our Logo

Our logo was designed by the lovely Ashton Rainbows. (website, Instagram)

Thank you Ashton!

Nivenly Discord

The Nivenly Foundation is the new (2023) parent organization for Hachyderm. You can join Nivenly's Discord here.
Short: Hachyderm is a safe space, LGBTQIA+ and BLM, primarily comprised of tech industry professionals world wide. Note that many non-user account types have restrictions - please see our About page.

Description:
Welcome to Famichiki!

Famichiki is a community-driven Mastodon server operated by a small group of foreigners residing in Japan. While we primarily have English speakers in our community, we welcome users of all languages. Our platform is designed for foreigners who currently live, have lived, or are interested in living in Japan, as well as Japanese individuals seeking to engage with the international community in our chosen home.

Join our platform to connect with an active and diverse community. Whether you’re an English speaker or prefer another language, you’ll find comradeship and valuable resources for navigating life in Japan.

Volunteer Driven and Community Financed

Famichiki Mastodon is run by unpaid volunteers and our infrastructure is paid for 100% by donations from our community. While donations are not mandatory, we appreciate any contributions you can make. Donations can be one time or regular subscription payments, and even anonymously if that’s more to your liking. Contributions can be made via our Open Collective page. We’re looking at adding benefits for paying subscribers - please check @admins for further updates!

Our Team

The server is moderated by the following people:

  • @brian
  • @lukas
  • @pippa
  • @savvykenya
  • @flockofcats

All of our team are involved in the day to day operation of the server, so please don’t hesitate to reach out to any of us (or the @admins account) if you have any questions or need any help.

Discord

We are also on Discord! Participation on Discord is encouraged but by no means required. If the server is down for whatever reason, Discord will be the first place of contact.

Regarding Our Rules

These rules exist to ensure a positive community experience for all of our members. No moderation decision is automatic; every report is reviewed by one of our team and, where necessary, acted on in agreement with other team members. If you feel as though you have been penalized unfairly, please feel free to reach out either via an appeal or by emailing us. We do defederate from servers whose policies clearly lie against our own; please check the ‘moderated servers’ list for more information.
Short: We are a community-driven server operated by a diverse group of foreigners residing in Japan. While we primarily have English speakers in our community, we welcome users of all languages.

Description:
Tento mastodon server provozuje kolektiv NoLog.cz díky darům od našich podporovatelů a podporovatelek. Pokud se k nim chcete přidat a podpořit tuto i další služby, které pro veřejnost provozujeme, podpořte nás prosím také.

Narozdíl od všech našich ostatních služeb zde dočasně ukládáne IP adresy použíté při registraci uživatele abychom omezili množství spamu a zneužívání Witteru. Nikdy ale neopustí systém Mastodon a zobrazit si je mohou pouze administrátoři*ky a moderátoři*ky tohoto serveru.

NoLog z. s. je spolek zapsaný u Městského soudu v Praze, odd. L vložka 73240.

Bez reklam, sbírání osobních informací a sledování uživatelů.

Description:
Hi! This is a general-purpose Mastodon server. It does not have any particular topic or target audience. Everyone is welcome to sign up as long as they are willing to follow our rules set out below.

In addition to the information provided below, we also have a blog and about page at about.ohai.social.

Support

The best way to get in touch for questions and issues concerning the server is through support@ohai.social.

Donations

We accept donations toward the operation of the server through Patreon.

Moderation team

There are currently three moderators for ohai.social:

  • @dee_in_calgary (she/her) 🇨🇦
  • @lutoma (he/him) 🇪🇺
  • @silsha (he/him) 🇪🇺

Server status

You can check the current server status on our monitoring page at status.ohai.is.

Security & Backups

This Mastodon server is hosted on bare metal in a data center in the south of Germany. Two people have access to the infrastructure, and all SSH access is exclusively using hardware security tokens. We will never sell or otherwise use your data for anything other than the operation of this Mastodon server, and we certainly do not read your DMs.

All database data is backed up twice daily in a physically different location from the live data (Specifically, at BorgBase).

In the unlikely event that we will ever have to shut down the server, we intend to give at least 6+ months of notice ahead of the shutdown.

Best practices

The list below is a collection of behavior that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.

  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.

  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.

  • If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.

  • If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.

  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.

  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions ("…@twitter.com"). Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.

  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of chaos.social and bsd.network. Thank you!)

Legal notice (Impressum)

Registered DMCA agent according to 37 CFR § 201.38 and information provided according to Sec. 5 German Telemedia Act (TMG):
